Name: Phnom Penh
Description: The capital and largest city of Cambodia, known for its historical landmarks, such as the Royal Palace and the Killing Fields, and its vibrant culture.

Name: Battambang
Description: A province in western Cambodia known for its colonial architecture, historical sites, and picturesque countryside.

Name: Siem Reap
Description: Famous for the Angkor Archaeological Park, home to the ancient temples of Angkor Wat and other UNESCO World Heritage sites.

Name: Kampong Cham
Description: A province in eastern Cambodia, known for its agriculture, including rubber and rice farming, and its scenic riverside views.

Name: Kampong Speu
Description: A province located to the southwest of Phnom Penh, known for its agricultural production, including palm sugar and other crops.

Name: Kandal
Description: A province surrounding Phnom Penh, known for its proximity to the capital, agriculture, and fishing industries.

Name: Preah Sihanouk
Description: A coastal province on the Gulf of Thailand, known for its beaches, resorts, and the port city of Sihanoukville.

Name: Takeo
Description: A southern province of Cambodia, known for its temples, historical sites, and its proximity to Vietnam.

Name: Koh Kong
Description: A coastal province in southwestern Cambodia, known for its natural reserves, rivers, and the Cardamom Mountains.

Name: Mondulkiri
Description: A northeastern province known for its forests, waterfalls, and indigenous Bunong people, as well as its wildlife sanctuary.

Name: Ratanakiri
Description: A province located in the northeast, known for its rich biodiversity, natural parks, and the indigenous communities living there.

Name: Stung Treng
Description: A province in the northeastern part of Cambodia, known for its natural resources, including rivers, forests, and wildlife.

Name: Kratié
Description: Located in the northeastern part of Cambodia, known for its Mekong River views and endangered freshwater dolphins.

Name: Prey Veng
Description: A province in southeastern Cambodia, known for its fertile rice fields and agricultural economy.

Name: Svay Rieng
Description: A province in southeastern Cambodia, known for its agricultural production and proximity to Vietnam.

Name: Banteay Meanchey
Description: A province located in the northwest, known for its historical and cultural heritage, including Angkorian ruins.

Name: Oddar Meanchey
Description: A province in the northwest, known for its mountainous terrain and the natural beauty of the area.

Name: Pailin
Description: A province in western Cambodia, known for its gem mining and scenic hills.
